intro: Rinorea longisepala, commonly known as the long-sepaled rinorea, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Its leaves are ovate to elliptical in shape and often have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Rinorea longisepala is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along stream banks.
